input:
Sevilla 1 - 3 Manchester

First Half:

10:40 Caption: Sergio Rico gets a well deserved ovation! Wilfried Bony (Manchester City) produces a decent first-time strike towards the left post, but the goalkeeper is positioned well to block it. Nice goalkeeping skills.
10:55 Caption: Fernandinho (Manchester City) glances a header goalwards from a rebound inside the penalty area. His effort ends in the back of the net and the assistance goes to Wilfried Bony. The score has changed to 0:2.
11:36 Event: Kick-off by Sevilla
11:45 Event: Ball out of play
11:51 Event: Throw-in by Sevilla
12:11 Event: Shots off target by Manchester
12:14 Caption: Jesus Navas (Manchester City) shows off his amazing technique to get in front of goal by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the left post. Nice run, but unlucky finish!
12:16 Event: Ball out of play
12:41 Event: Throw-in by Manchester
13:48 Caption: Victor Vitolo (Sevilla) sends a cross into the box, but the opposition's defence clears the ball away to eliminate the danger.
14:43 Event: Ball out of play
14:45 Event: Throw-in by Sevilla
14:52 Event: Shots off target by Sevilla
14:52 Event: Ball out of play
14:54 Caption: Fernando Llorente (Sevilla) does well to meet a cross from Iborra, but he directs his shot just over the crossbar.
15:23 Event: Clearance by Manchester
16:17 Event: Shots on target by Manchester
16:19 Caption: What a goal-scoring opportunity! Yaya Toure (Manchester City) finds some space inside the box and fires a volley at goal, but the shot is amazingly blocked by a defender.
16:40 Event: Shots on target by Manchester
16:42 Caption: The defence had a hard time blocking out the strike from Wilfried Bony (Manchester City). He didn't hesitate and finished from outside the box right after he had received a pass from his teammate.
16:44 Event: Ball out of play
17:06 Event: Throw-in by Manchester
17:43 Event: Ball out of play
17:45 Event: Throw-in by Sevilla

18:46 Event: Ball out of play
18:46 Caption: Benoit Tremoulinas (Sevilla) attempts to find the head of one of his teammates with a promising cross into the box, but a defender outjumps the attackers and averts the threat. Sevilla have been awarded a corner kick.
19:06 Caption: Evgen Konoplyanka (Sevilla) quickly takes the corner kick with a short pass.
19:17 Event: Corner by Sevilla
19:33 Event: Ball out of play
19:36 Event: Throw-in by Sevilla
19:49 Caption: Evgen Konoplyanka (Sevilla) delivers a fine lofted cross into the penalty area, but it's cleared by an opposing player.
20:16 Event: Shots off target by Manchester
20:16 Caption: A great solo effort from Jesus Navas (Manchester City) and he attempts to surprise the goalkeeper with a long-range shot low towards the middle of the goal. Sergio Rico has a clear view of it and makes a comfortable save.
20:51 Event: Ball out of play
21:14 Event: Clearance by Manchester
22:24 Caption: Benoit Tremoulinas (Sevilla) sends a beautiful cross into the penalty area, but the opposition's defence manages to clear the ball to safety.

23:07 Caption: Yaya Toure (Manchester City) brings down his opponent with a very late tackle. That's a free kick to Sevilla.
23:18 Event: Indirect free-kick by Sevilla

24:10 Event: Goal by Sevilla
24:46 Caption: Goal! A great cross from Coke finds Benoit Tremoulinas (Sevilla), who scores with a simple header into an empty net. 1:2.
25:35 Caption: The game is interrupted now, Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) picks up a knock and the physio has to come on.
26:07 Event: Kick-off by Manchester
26:25 Caption: Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) hasn't suffered any serious injury which would see him leave the pitch. He's back in the game now.
26:32 Event: Ball out of play
26:57 Event: Throw-in by Sevilla

27:46 Caption: Evgen Konoplyanka (Sevilla) goes over to take the corner kick and it looks like he will swing the ball into the penalty box.

28:51 Event: Ball out of play
29:09 Caption: Fernando Llorente (Sevilla) is furious with himself as he misses a clear opportunity. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the right post.
29:29 Event: Indirect free-kick by Sevilla
30:44 Event: Ball out of play
30:53 Event: Throw-in by Manchester
31:08 Event: Foul by Sevilla
31:13 Caption: Svein Moen blows his whistle for a foul after Benoit Tremoulinas (Sevilla) hacks down one of his opponents. There is a free kick near the sideline to Manchester City.
31:46 Event: Indirect free-kick by Manchester
32:00 Event: Shots off target by Manchester
32:00 Caption: Wilfried Bony (Manchester City) collects a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a shot which is brilliantly blocked by a defender. Now Manchester City have a corner.
32:01 Event: Ball out of play
32:24 Event: Corner by Manchester
32:24 Caption: Jesus Navas (Manchester City) takes the corner.
32:26 Event: Shots on target by Manchester
32:34 Caption: Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) outjumps the defence to meet the resulting corner and heads the ball towards the middle of the goal. The long-range header is not powerful enough, and the keeper comfortably makes a save.
33:29 Event: Shots off target by Manchester
33:30 Event: Ball out of play
33:31 Caption: Fernandinho (Manchester City) unleashes a shot from 22 metres out but is unable to find the target and it goes well wide of the left post.
33:45 Event: Clearance by Sevilla
34:13 Caption: Evgen Konoplyanka (Sevilla) creates himself some space and attempts to put the ball into the box. However, the defender gets an important foot in to clear. Good work from Sevilla as they win a corner.
34:14 Event: Ball out of play
34:23 Caption: Evgen Konoplyanka (Sevilla) attempts to find a teammate with the corner, but the effort is snuffed out by the goalkeeper.
34:41 Event: Corner by Sevilla
35:07 Event: Shots on target by Manchester
35:08 Event: Goal by Manchester
35:31 Caption: Goal Wilfried Bony (Manchester City)! Wilfried Bony (Manchester City) was put through by Jesus Navas and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom right corner. 1:3.
36:08 Event: Kick-off by Sevilla
36:44 Event: Ball out of play
36:45 Caption: Decent spell from Sevilla here and they keep the pressure on until one of the defending players steps in. The referee and the linesman both signal a throw-in for Sevilla.
36:47 Event: Throw-in by Sevilla
37:02 Event: Foul by Manchester
37:06 Caption: Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) makes a slide tackle, but referee Svein Moen blows for a foul. A free kick to Sevilla.

39:37 Caption: Aleksandar Kolarov (Manchester City) sends a pass into the box, but the opposition's defence is alert to the danger and makes a clearance. The ball goes out of play and Manchester City have been awarded a corner kick.
39:57 Caption: Aleksandar Kolarov (Manchester City) looks like he will be the one to try and deliver a quality ball into the penalty box from the corner kick.
39:59 Event: Corner by Manchester
40:00 Event: Ball out of play
40:08 Event: Clearance by Sevilla
40:10 Caption: Aleksandar Kolarov (Manchester City) didn't manage to convert the resulting corner kick into a goal. He produced a header from a dangerous position inside the box, but it goes well wide of the left post.
40:12 Event: Ball out of play
40:20 Event: Throw-in by Sevilla
40:34 Event: Ball out of play

42:45 Event: Yellow card by Sevilla
42:52 Caption: A yellow card for a tackle by Grzegorz Krychowiak (Sevilla). Svein Moen doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
43:28 Event: Indirect free-kick by Manchester
43:48 Caption: The defence is alert as they clear a dangerous cross from Aleksandar Kolarov (Manchester City).
43:58 Event: Ball out of play
44:00 Event: Throw-in by Sevilla

44:39 Event: Indirect free-kick by Manchester
45:51 Caption: Coke (Sevilla) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him. Sevilla have a corner.
46:11 Caption: Evgen Konoplyanka (Sevilla) takes the corner which is cleared by the opposition's defence.
47:04 Caption: There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Svein Moen has ended it.
47:59 Caption: The fans can't complain about what they have been seeing so far on the pitch as both sides are playing highly attractive football. The visitors dominated that half and looked more dangerous in attack. The home team tries to prevail using combination football, while the away teams uses mostly counter-attacks.

Second Half:
00:00 Event: Substitution by Sevilla

38:00 Caption: We can have a look at the statistics now, particularly the total attempts – 11:22.
38:20 Event: Ball out of play

42:38 Event: Shots on target by Manchester
42:41 Caption: Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the middle of the goal. Sergio Rico pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
42:51 Event: Ball out of play
42:58 Event: Throw-in by Sevilla

45:13 Event: Clearance by Manchester
45:28 Event: Ball out of play
45:32 Event: Throw-in by Sevilla
45:46 Caption: Ciro Immobile (Sevilla) makes a yard for himself on the edge of the box after picking up a pass, but produces a poor effort that sails high over the bar.
46:49 Caption: Svein Moen blows his whistle and it's Ciro Immobile (Sevilla) who is penalised for an offensive foul. Good decision by the referee.
47:42 Caption: The Sevilla players are exchanging some short passes and control the game at the moment, but one of the defending players steps in and intercepts the ball. The ball has crossed the sideline. Sevilla are taking a throw-in.
48:10 Caption: Ciro Immobile (Sevilla) races towards goal but the defender gets back well to make a challenge. Sevilla will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
48:19 Caption: Ever Banega (Sevilla) goes over to take the corner kick and it looks like he will send the ball into the penalty box.
48:41 Caption: Adil Rami (Sevilla) didn't manage to convert the resulting corner kick into a goal. He produced a header from a dangerous position inside the box, but his attempt went well wide of the right post.
49:09 Caption: The match has just finished.
49:59 Caption: This is what football should look like. Full of action, thrilling moments and spectacular opportunities. The expectations for the next games will be high. The visitors controlled the game. The home team played possession football, while the away team tried to find the weakness in their defence using mainly rapid counter-attacks.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In a highly anticipated UEFA Champions League match, Sevilla hosted Manchester City at the Ramon Sanchez-Pizjuan Stadium, and the encounter was an absolute spectacle of football. The game delivered everything one would expect from a top-level European clash: goals, intricate play, tactical battles, and individual moments of brilliance.

The first half kicked off with Manchester City taking the initiative. Within the first minute, Manchester City showcased their attacking intent with a shot, although it went off target. Sevilla cleared the ball to regroup. Another attempt from Manchester City followed soon after, again missing its mark. The early pressure from Manchester City hinted at what was to come. Less than four minutes into the game, Manchester City's persistent pressure forced an indirect free-kick after a foul by Sevilla. A short while later, Manchester City launched another on-target effort, showing the visitors' tenacity and determination to dominate.

Sevilla tried to counter City's relentless attacks, but by the seventh minute, Manchester City’s efforts bore fruit. A well-coordinated move saw a Manchester City player find the back of the net, sending the visitor's fans into a frenzy. Sevilla restarted the game, eager to get back into it, but Manchester City wasn't done yet. Barely two minutes after their first goal, another precise attack resulted in a remarkable finish. Wilfried Bony struck towards the left post, but Sergio Rico, the Sevilla goalkeeper, made a commendable save only for the ball to rebound. Fernandinho, ever opportunistic, headed the ball goalwards, doubling City's lead.

Sevilla, now down by two goals, attempted to regain control but found it hard to break Manchester City's defensive lines. Fernando Llorente had a chance but directed his header just over the bar. Soon after, another Manchester City attack reminded Sevilla of the visitors' attacking prowess. Yaya Toure got his shot off, but a Sevilla defender heroically blocked the attempt. Moments later, another strike from Wilfried Bony, this time from outside the box, tested Sevilla's defence yet again.

As the half progressed, Sevilla managed a slight respite, attempting crosses and corner kicks to create chances. One such opportunity finally materialized around the 24th minute when a perfect cross found Benoit Tremoulinas, who scored with a simple header, bringing Sevilla back into the game at 1-2. However, Manchester City’s response was swift and decisive. Barely ten minutes later, Wilfried Bony was at it again, receiving a brilliant pass from Jesus Navas and showing great composure to score into the bottom right corner, restoring City's two-goal advantage.

By the end of the first half, Sevilla's frustration began to show, with Bryan Krychowiak receiving a yellow card for a foul. As the whistle blew to end the first half, it was clear that Manchester City had been the more dominant team, displaying superior attacking football and clinical finishing.

The second half began with Sevilla making a tactical substitution, bringing Michael Krohn-Dehli on to replace Iborra. The home side tried to exert pressure early in the half but found it difficult to penetrate Manchester City's organized defence. Coke's early strikes were either blocked or went off target, reflecting Sevilla's struggles in front of goal despite their spirited attempts. Another substitution for Sevilla saw Mariano replacing Coke as the game continued, undoubtedly an effort to reinvigorate their attack.

Manchester City remained adverse, and Sergio Rico had to be at his best to deny Fernandinho's clear goal-scoring opportunity, emphasizing the ongoing threat posed by the visitors. Sevilla, despite their endeavors, continued to grapple with the clinical efficiency displayed by Manchester City's forward line.

Sevilla continued to push, utilizing crosses and corners, but their efforts were consistently undone, either by mistimed headers or smart defending by Manchester City. A tactical decision was made in the 19th minute to bring on Ciro Immobile for Fernando Llorente. Sevilla's attack became more dynamic, with quick exchanges of short passes, though tangible chances remained elusive.

Manchester City also made tactical substitutions, with Fabian Delph replacing Wilfried Bony, and later Martin Demichelis coming on for the injured Fernandinho. Despite two substitution changes, Manchester City kept up their combative spirit, ensuring that Sevilla's attempts to claw back into the match were thwarted.

As the second half dwindled down, Kevin De Bruyne replaced Raheem Sterling, adding fresh legs to Manchester City's midfield. The Belgian international made an immediate impact, firing a shot that was superbly saved by Sevilla’s keeper, Sergio Rico.

By now, Sevilla was visibly struggling to make significant headway against the resolute defensive setup of their opponents. Ciro Immobile found himself managing a few promising runs but failed to convert these into goals. As the game clock edged closer to full time, Sevilla maintained possession, trying to build pressure through passes and movement. Unfortunately for them, efforts to find the net ultimately fell short, with most creating few moments of genuine concern for the Manchester City defence.

The referee blew the final whistle after an exhausting match filled with end-to-end football. Manchester City emerged victorious with a 3-1 scoreline, markedly outclassing Sevilla in many aspects of the game. From the start, City had demonstrated a well-honed strategy, marked by quick passing, sharp finishing, and relentless pressing. Their ability to convert critical moments into goal-scoring opportunities had proved decisive and left Sevilla chasing the game.

In summary, this match was an exemplary showcase of attacking vs. defensive strategies. Manchester City’s counter-attacking approach, coupled with indefatigable resilience in defence, contrasted starkly with Sevilla's attempts to control the game through possession and intricate plays. Both teams played an attractive brand of football, but it was Manchester City who held a significant competitive edge throughout the ninety minutes.

Sevilla will have to reflect on their missed chances and defensive lapses, whereas Manchester City can take immense satisfaction from a competent performance reflecting precise tactical execution and individual brilliance. The match provided a rich tapestry of footballing action, replete with moments of skill, tactical intricacies, and sheer entertainment for the fans—a perfect advertisement for Champions League football.
